stories.text:
Hi HN.

Consider this to be a quick follow-up to my recent post complaining about Unity's UI system. The new UI element system finally allows defining your UI using XML with various CSS like attributes.

This is the best thing to happen to Unity in years, I went ahead and refactored my entire UX using it and I just can't be happier. The only real downside is this is very much for programmers only. You can't drag and drop events onto a UI element as you could with the previous UI system.

I'm still just getting started, I have an applied any themes to the UI yet, but this had made my life so much easier. It addresses one of Unity's biggest weaknesses, and while it's not perfect, the documentation is very sparse, it's pretty great.

While there is a very neat UI builder, you can also edit the XML directly, which I appreciate. You don't even need to use Unity to design your UI, assuming you're already comfortable with CSS.
stories.title: Tell HN: The new Unity UI elements system is amazing
